remarks: Lemma for well-founded recursion.  From here through ~ wfrlem16 , we aim to prove that ` dom F = A ` .  We do this by supposing that there is an element ` z ` of ` A ` that is not in ` dom F ` .  We then define ` C ` by extending ` dom F ` with the appropriate value at ` z ` .  We then show that ` z ` cannot be an ` R ` minimal element of ` ( A \ dom F ) ` , meaning that ` ( A \ dom F ) ` must be empty, so ` dom F = A ` .  Here, we show that ` C ` is a function extending the domain of ` F ` by one.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
statement:
wfrlem13.1 $e |- R We A $.
wfrlem13.2 $e |- R Se A $.
wfrlem13.3 $e |- F = wrecs ( R , A , G ) $.
wfrlem13.4 $e |- C = ( F u. { <. z , ( G ` ( F |` Pred ( R , A , z ) ) ) >. } ) $.
wfrlem13 $p |- ( z e. ( A \ dom F ) -> C Fn ( dom F u. { z } ) ) $.
$d A z $.
$d F z $.
$d R z $.
